title: Higher Ping for LAN that NA when I live next to LAN server?
body:
I live in South Florida, less than an hour from Miami, the location of the  LAN server. However, I get 60 ping on LAN and 50 on NA. What could cause this?


I have looked at my routing and it seems that I stay inside Florida the whole time. I have tried using Haste to see if that fixed the issue. I have even changed my DNS settings and flushed my old ones as demonstrated by Riot's own troubleshooting video. None of these things worked. The ping is stable and clearly playable, but it bugs me I don't know why it is so high.

I would love to be able to experience this game on lower ping and just wonder why I would get higher ping on a server that is literally right next door relatively.

replies.body:
It's likely that little bump is just coincidence or due to slightly different routing between the servers. 10ms difference isn't too big so it shouldn't be too bothersome, and it could also be stemming from the Verizon issues we're seeing all along the east coast.

If you want to see exactly what's going on, you could run traceroutes to the NA and LAN server to see the differences. Use a program like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to run these traces, and feel free to post the results here and I'll go over them with you!

NA:   104.160.131.1
LAN: 66.151.33.248

That last one was based off an IP address given out by a Rioter on reddit,

here is the one you just gave me

I had one of our techs look over this, and they mentioned this should be alright since the trace looked fine all the way to riotdirect. I want you to get in touch with our techs so they can look deeper into this with you. Hit them up in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with this traceroute data, and be sure to send over your network logs too!
